text: , Campbellsville offers a wide selection of online programs that are tailored to your career path.
, Campbellsville offers a wide selection of online programs that are tailored to your career path.
Our well-rounded education in the arts and sciences is central to our goal of fostering your personal and professional growth.
Founded in 1906 as a Christian university, we welcome diverse perspectives and prepare students to become Christian servant leaders.
Campbellsville seeks to provide an affordable education for its students. Our online degree programs are in a convenient format so you can study whenever and wherever you want.
Along with our regional and advanced accreditations, we also have been recognized by the following organizations for our excellence in education.
See how affordable it is to take CU Online classes.
Discover how easily you can transfer your credits.
Learn how CU Online helps military students earn their degrees.
Still have questions? Visit our Frequently Asked Questions page for more information.
Yes. We offer a generous transfer policy for our online degree programs. Visit our

You can apply to our online degree programs through the online application form. Remember to submit official copies of your high school and/or college transcripts, along with any other required documentation that is specific to your degree program. You can visit
to learn more about what to expect throughout the process.
Yes. You will have to complete the FAFSA form, and we will then determine your eligibility for any financial aid. Visit
to learn more about your options, which include scholarships and grants.

Campbellsville University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges to award certificates, associate, baccalaureate, masters and doctoral degrees. Contact the Commission on Colleges at 1866 Southern Lane, Decatur, Georgia 30033-4097 or call 404-679-4500 for questions about the status of Campbellsville University.
What kind of Tiger are you?
CU offers many degree programs catered to the kind of Tiger you are. Are you a
? See how you can find your calling at CU.

You entrust us to offer safety and guidance to your child on their journey to find their calling. When your child joins the Campbellsville family, so do you. You can learn about what we offer at CU with the links above.
At CU, we want you to make a difference in our students’ lives. CU is located in Campbellsville, a vibrant town with a growing community in the middle of Kentucky.

Whether you earned your stripes as a Campbellsville student or made your Tiger name known through your contributions to our school, cause, and community, we are proud to have you as a part of our family.
Follow us for updates on Facebook
as we cheer on our CU Tiger student-athletes!
CU offers more than 90 degree programs in multiple areas catered to the kind of Tiger you are.
With 54 degrees available, Campbellsville offers a wide selection of online programs that are tailored to your career path.
Campbellsville University’s academic calendar runs August 1 through July 31.
View Our Calendar to Learn More
Take individual classes that count toward a Liberal Arts and Sciences degree, earn an Allied Health certificate, and receive financial aid and work ready scholarships.
Preparing Students for College, a Career, and Life, CU offers a range of Allied Health technical programs.
Offering undergraduate programs in Interdisciplinary Early Childhood Education (IECE) and Early Childhood Education (ECE).
The Conover Center is committed to providing a Christ-centered, high quality educational experience by locating and retaining highly qualified and credentialed instructors.
The Brockman Center is fully equipped with all of the tools and equipment you need to prepare for your professional career in Allied Health or Cosmetology.
With two locations in Louisville, Ky., CU Louisville boasts several degree options and certifications, including the Master of Science in Information Technology Management.
Receive quality educational preparation for successful transition to student teaching, K-TIP, and educational institutions.
CU’s Noe Somerset Education Center offers adult learners an accelerated program where classes are available both day and night, Monday-Friday.
Are you ready to become a Campbellsville Tiger?
The first step to joining Campbellsville’s passion-driven, faith-focused community is to apply!
Learn more about what scholarships and grants we offer!
Dual Credit for High School Students
CU partners with over 30 high schools to offer qualified high school students the opportunity to enroll in CU courses for college credit.
Whether you are actively serving, in the reserves, are a veteran, or a military family member, we are very proud you are considering Campbellsville University and thank you for considering us.
Live the Life of a Tiger
When you choose CU, you’re choosing to be more than a student, an athlete, or a Christian. You’re choosing to be a Tiger. And at Campbellsville, that means belonging.
Here at Campbellsville, it is our goal to provide you with a broad range of faith-oriented opportunities so you not only stay resolute in your faith, but grow in it.
All incoming freshmen have the opportunity to connect with classmates, faculty and staff in an environment where they will begin to engage in campus life intellectually, socially and spiritually!
Campbellsville Student events, intramural sports, movies, concerts, workshops and more.

Students advancing the Kingdom Of God.
Promoting conservation by increasing public awareness of the importance of forests

School of Business, Economics, and Technology

Campbellsville University’s CU RISE Evening/Weekend program is designed for the adult learner who is wanting to pursue a degree in a convenient and affordable weekend/blended format that only requires you to come to campus every other weekend, or online.
CU RISE is open to former Campbellsville University students, transfer students and first time college freshman. First time college students must be
to be considered for admission to this program.

Courses are held in seat every other Friday evening and Saturday morning and one online class. To be considered full time, you must register for two (2) courses per 8-week sessions, or a total of four (4) courses per 16-week sessions. Summer sessions will also be offered.
Associate of Applied Science in Business Administration
Associate of Science in Business Information Technology
Bachelor of Science in Business Administration

. Reach out to the CU RISE Office to communicate your interests in our weekend program. We will answer your questions and guide you through the admission process. You may contact the CU RISE Director at 270-789-5200
For assistance with your FAFSA application you can contact Financial Aid at 270-789-5013
. Submit your college or university transcripts. If you have not previously attended a college or university, please submit your high school transcripts or GED.
. After submitting your application and documents we will conduct an unofficial review to determine how many past credits will transfer.
. Once admitted, we contact you to select classes and register for your first term.
Campbellsville University offers a range of financial aid options as well as discounted rates for the CURISE program.

Tuition for students accepted into the CU RISE program is $399 per credit hour. Students MUST complete the FREE Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) in order to be eligible for this discounted rate. We also welcome employer tuition reimbursement. If your employer provides this benefit to you, you will need to make arrangements with your employer and with our business office.
For more information about the CU RISE Weekend Program, or to schedule an appointment, please contact:
